choices.D: The mined currency is associated with a user token.
choices.E: Common cryptominer port usage was found.
choices.B: High CPU usage over time for the container is detected.
choices.A: The value of the mined currency exceeds $100.
choices.C: Common cryptominer process name was found.

questions.question_text:
A customer is reviewing Container audits, and an audit has identified a cryptominer attack.
Which three options could have generated this audit? (Choose three.)

discussion.content: BCE. Prisma cloud is unable to detect D.

Selected Answer: BCE
B. High CPU usage over time for the container is a common indicator of a cryptominer attack. Cryptominers utilize the computational resources of a system to mine cryptocurrencies, which often leads to increased CPU usage.

C. Detection of a common cryptominer process name can trigger an audit. Cryptominers typically run specific processes or executables with recognizable names that indicate their presence.

E. Discovery of common cryptominer port usage can also generate an audit. Cryptominers often communicate with mining pools or other components using specific ports associated with cryptocurrency mining.

C

IAM > Roles > Select your role for PrismaCloud > Trust relationships
Make sure AWS Master External ID is matching as entered in Prisma Cloud
Make sure Prisma Cloud account found in Trusted entities

choices.D: It is the default name of the PrismaCloudApp stack.
choices.C: It is a UUID that establishes a trust relationship between the Prisma Cloud account and the AWS account in order to extract data.
choices.A: It is a unique identifier needed only when Monitor & Protect mode is selected.
choices.B: It is the resource name for the Prisma Cloud Role.

choices.D: config from cloud.resource where api.name = ‘azure-active-directory-authorization-policy’ AND json.rule = defaultUserRolePermissions.allowedToCreateSecurityGroups is true and defaultUserRolePermissions.allowedToCreateApps is true
choices.B: config from cloud.resource where api.name = ‘azure-active-directory-authorization-policy’ AND json.rule = defaultUserRolePermissions exists
